competitors.name: Oracle Exadata
competitors.notes: Database machine for data warehousing and OLTP

competitors.name: IBM Netezza
competitors.notes: Data warehouse appliance, acquired by IBM 2010

competitors.name: Greenplum
competitors.notes: Massively parallel data warehouse, acquired by EMC 2010

context: In 2010, Teradata was the leading enterprise data warehouse vendor. IBM acquired Netezza for $1.7B and EMC acquired Greenplum, signaling market consolidation. Oracle Exadata competed with engineered systems approach. The data warehouse market was mature but growing with big data trends. Hadoop was emerging as potential competitor/complement. Teradata focused on enterprise analytics and petabyte-scale data warehousing.
